title: Serious Game Design in Medical Education: Tailored Approaches for Advanced Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical knowledge, understanding of mathematical modeling, experience with digital tools
context.additional_context: Learners are working professionals with time constraints, preferring education methods applicable to practical tasks. Collaborative learning using personal devices (BYOD) is emphasized.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze game mechanics based on medical scenarios to evaluate their alignment with educational objectives.
Learners can derive at least three game design elements applying advanced mathematical concepts.
Learners can develop a game interface prototype considering the target learners' characteristics (non-gaming female medical students).

resources: Game Development Tools (e.g., Unity/Scratch Educational Editions)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
